TaxonIdentification.species_authority: (H. M. Hall ex D. D. Keck) B. G. Baldwin

treatment.description: Stems usually erect, sparsely to densely leafy. Heads in open, paniculiform arrays. Ray florets 8–13(–15). Disc florets 11–32. 2n = 24.
treatment.habitat: fallow fields), often sandy or clayey soils
treatment.discussion: Subspecies increscens occurs in foothills and valleys of the South Coast Ranges, on the immediate Central Coast and northern South Coast, and on Santa Rosa Island.
